Leonardo da Vinci: I would bring Leonardo da Vinci back to life because he was an incredible polymath who excelled in fields such as art, science, and engineering. He had a curious mind and a deep understanding of the world around him, and I believe he would have made significant contributions to modern science and technology.

Marie Curie: I would bring Marie Curie back to life because she was a pioneering scientist who made groundbreaking discoveries in the field of radioactivity. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and the first person to win two Nobel Prizes in different fields. Her work has had a profound impact on modern medicine and energy production.

Albert Einstein: I would bring Albert Einstein back to life because he was one of the most influential scientists of the 20th century. He developed the theory of relativity, which revolutionized our understanding of space and time. He also made significant contributions to the development of quantum mechanics and the photoelectric effect.

Cleopatra: I would bring Cleopatra back to life because she was a powerful and influential queen who ruled Egypt during a time of great political and cultural change. She was known for her intelligence, charisma, and diplomatic skills, and I believe she would have made significant contributions to the fields of politics, art, and literature.
